faqs.question: Are there any server files for your packs?
faqs.answer: Yes, you can get the latest server files for the modpack by visiting our [CurseForge](https://www.curseforge.com/members/teamampz/projects) page. On CurseForge, select the modpack you want, choose the desired version, and look under the "Additional Files" tab to find the server files. For Modrinth, please see the "I use Modrinth where can I get the server files?" question.

faqs.question: I use Modrinth where can I get the server files?
faqs.answer: For modpack-server-files hosted on Modrinth, navigate to your desired modpack, click on `Versions`, select the recommended latest version, and scroll all the way down to find the server files.

faqs.question: How to add custom mods to modpacks?
faqs.answer: Depending on your launcher, navigate to the installation directory, then to instances, and find your desired instance (modpack). Drag the mod(s) `.jar` file(s) you wish to install into the `/mods` directory.

faqs.question: My game is crashing since I've added Optifine?
faqs.answer: Depending on the modpack you’re using, some of our packs include optimization mods like Sodium. For more details, please refer to the modpack project page, where it outlines which mods need to be removed for Optifine compatibility. Alternatively, you can remove Optifine, as it may cause conflicts with other mods due to its closed-source nature.

faqs.question: How to claim land on our modpacks?
faqs.answer:
Depending on the server you're playing on, land claiming methods vary. For example, **All The Fabric** uses a mod called **Flan Mod**, and **All The Forge** uses the **WorldGuard** plugin.

faqs.question: How do I install Optifine?
faqs.answer:
Download OptiFine from the [official website](https://optifine.net/downloads), ensure Java is installed, open the **OptiFine.jar** file with Java, extract the mod from the installer to your desktop, and copy the mod from your desktop into the modpack's mod folder.

For CurseForge, open the CurseForge app, select your modpack, click the three dots, choose `Open Folder`, and navigate to the `mods` folder.

For ATLauncher, open the ATLauncher app, select your modpack, click `Open Folder`, and navigate to the `mods` folder.

faqs.question: I don't see a shaders menu
faqs.answer: For shaders to work, install [Sodium](https://modrinth.com/mod/sodium)/[Embeddium](https://modrinth.com/mod/embeddium) and [Iris](https://modrinth.com/mod/iris)/[Oculus](https://modrinth.com/mod/oculus), depending on whether you're running a Fabric- or Forge-based modpack. After installing, find the shaders option in-game by navigating to **Options > Video Settings**.

faqs.question: Changing the server RAM amount?
faqs.answer: Adjusting the RAM allocated to your server is simple. Open `user_jvm_args.txt`, locate the line containing `-Xmx4G`, and change the number to reflect your desired RAM amount. For example, to allocate 8GB, change `-Xmx4G` to `-Xmx8G`. This applies only to self-hosted servers. If you're using a hosting provider, you'll need to upgrade your plan. For Fabric server files, open the `server-setup-config.yaml`, find the line `maxRam: 3G`, and change it to your desired RAM amount.

faqs.question: How can I remove the graves from the modpack I'm playing?
faqs.answer:
You can remove Ketkets Graves by following these steps. If you've already loaded a world or server, first run `/function grave_ketket:uninstall` to avoid risking your save.

1. Go to the modpack root directory (accessible in-game via **Options > Resource Packs**).
2. Open the `config` folder.
3. Locate the `OpenLoader` folder (Note: In **All The Forge v11** or **All The Fabric v6** and later, this datapack has been removed).
4. Open the `data` folder, delete the `ketkets-graves` file, and restart the modpack.
